intro: Henckelia coodei, commonly known as the Coode's henckelia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
